Class IndProgressMonitor

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.ProgressMonitor
us.mn.state.dot.tms.client.reports.IndProgressMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Accessible
public class IndProgressMonitor extends ProgressMonitor
Similar to a standard Swing ProgressMonitor, but this shows a bouncing "indeterminate" progress bar. Note: The ability to directly access the internal progress bar object via reflection was removed by a Java security update, so this now has a "planB" fallback where it loops a linear progress bar moving from 5 to 95 until the report finishes.
Author:
John L. Stanley - SRF Consulting

  • Method Details

    • setProgress

      public void setProgress(int nv)
      Update the progress monitor. (Retained for compatibility with ProgressMonitor. When using IndProgressMonitor, I recommend calling the update() method instead.) This or update() should be called occasionally (every 1/10 sec is a good interval) while the process is running to display the progress monitor animation.
      Overrides:
      setProgress in class ProgressMonitor
      Parameters:
      nv - an int specifying the current value, between the maximum and minimum specified for this component. The nv value is mostly ignored, but, if the specified value is >= 100, the progress monitor will be closed.

    • update

      public void update()
      Slightly more intuitive method to use in place of setProgress(0).
